title: Superyacht Crew visa (subclass 488)
summary: This page provides information for holders and former sponsors of the now-closed Superyacht Crew visa (subclass 488). It explains visa conditions, work rights, obligations, what to do if employment changes, and sponsorship requirements. It also outlines transitional arrangements for moving to the Temporary Activity visa (subclass 408).

visa_details.applicable_to: people already granted a Superyacht Crew visa (subclass 488)

visa_duration.notes: To apply for a further visa while in Australia as a superyacht crew member you must apply for a Temporary Activity visa (subclass 408) while holding a valid visa.

permissions: Stay in Australia for up to 12 months (or 3/6 months depending on grant)
Enter Australia multiple times while visa is valid
Work on the sponsor's superyacht while in Australia
work_restrictions: Cannot perform work outside the usual day‑to‑day routine maintenance or business of the superyacht

work_obligations: Work only as a superyacht crew member
Work only for the sponsoring employer
Cannot work for another person or for yourself
Cannot work for the sponsor or yacht owner beyond day‑to‑day routine business

if_employment_ceases: Find another employer willing to sponsor you and apply for another subclass 488 visa
Leave Australia within 28 days or before your visa ends
if_employment_changes.changing_employer: Requires new sponsorship and a new Superyacht Crew visa (subclass 488).
conditions_for_further_488_visa_applicat: Must apply while holding a valid subclass 488 visa or another valid Australian visa

change_notification_requirements.notes: Instructions provided for how to notify the department.

sponsor_information.applicable_to: Approved sponsors for a Superyacht Crew visa (subclass 488)
sponsor_information.vevo_access: Sponsors can use VEVO for Organisations to check visa status and entitlements.
sponsor_information.sponsorship_availability: Cannot apply to sponsor new applicants because the visa is closed.

transitional_arrangements.condition: Sponsor must have been approved before 19 November 2016
transitional_arrangements.post_transition_requirement: From 19 May 2017, sponsors must apply online for approval as a temporary activities sponsor

applications_lodged_before_closure.assessment_rule: Applications lodged before 19 November 2016 assessed under pre‑19 November 2016 legislation
applications_lodged_before_closure.validity_of_sponsorship: Valid only for sponsoring new subclass 408 applicants until 18 May 2017

list_of_obligations: Notify the department when certain events occur
Not recover, transfer, or charge certain costs to another person
Provide records and information to the Minister
Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non‑citizen
sponsorship_obligations.responsibility_note: Sponsors remain responsible even if someone else (including a migration agent) acts on their behalf.

obligation_period.starts: On the day sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.ends: Five years after the approved sponsorship or work agreement ceases

examples_of_cooperation: Not preventing access to persons with custody of records or documents
Providing officers access to interview any person on premises

requirements: Keep records that show compliance with obligations
Some records must be independently verifiable
records_to_keep: Any required notification made to the department
How and where the notification was made

obligation_period.starts: On the day the sponsorship is approved
obligation_period.ends: Two years after the sponsor is no longer approved AND no longer sponsoring anyone

requirements: Provide records/information requested by a departmental officer
Information must relate to sponsorship obligations or circumstances permitting administrative action
provide_records_and_information.request_method: Requests may be issued in writing
records_that_must_be_provided: Records required under Commonwealth, state, or territory law
Records required to be kept as a sponsor

obligation_period.starts: On the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.ends: Two years after sponsorship/work agreement ceases and no sponsored visa holders remain

requirements: Sponsors must notify the department in writing via registered post or email
events_to_report: Changes to address or contact details in sponsor’s application
Cessation or expected cessation of a primary sponsored person's employment
additional_conditions: If cessation does not occur or occurs on a different date, sponsor must update the department

obligation_period.starts: On approval of sponsorship or commencement of work agreement
obligation_period.ends: Two years after sponsorship or work agreement ends AND no one is being sponsored
